did.unittitle: Journal historique concernant l'établissement des Francais à la Louisianne, 1699-1723
did.abstract: Journal ("Journal historique concernant l'établisement des français à la Louisianne; tiré des mémoires de Mrs. D'Iberville & de Bienville") from first French contact through failure of settlement at St. Bernard, commanded by La Harpe. Includes brief essays at end, including a summary of various theories of the origins of the American Indians.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Bénard de La Harpe, Jean Baptiste, 1683-1765

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This volume was copied from the original in possession of Dr. John Sibley in 1805 (certified, Nachitoches, October 29, 1805). It is taken from the memoirs of d'Iberville and Bienville. A few pages copied from Department of State's copy.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This item is also available on microfilm (Film 1442).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Jean Baptiste Bénard de La Harpe was a French officer and explorer.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This volume was translated and published in B. F. French, Historical Collections of Louisiana, pt. 3 (New York, 1851).

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This volume appears to be a record of early French colonization efforts in Louisiana (1699-1723). Historical Collections of Louisiana published in 1851 contains a translation of this journal.
